abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Kazakhstan Uzen Oil
            Field Rehabilitation Project were as follows: outcomes for
            the first project were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satsifactory.
            Some lessons learned included: 1) Rehabilitation of old oil
            fields (or other rehabilitation projects) takes a
            substantial amount of time and is complex; 2) The Bank, if
            it does other such projects, especially oil fields, must be
            willing to accept the substantial amount of time required;
            3) unlike greenfield projects, rehabilitation project costs
            are less certain since the condition of the underlying asset
            is usually not fully known; and 4) often, rehabilitation
            projects have high returns since most of the investment is
            already made.
